sub_title: Primary Teacher at Dharma Centrum Padma Öselling
summary:
I was born in Rotterdam in the Netherlands in 1954 
have a technical scientific and artistic background, both on dergree level, I accomplished  those studies in the Netherlands. 

I lived in the UK for 27 years and worked in the early day's of the FPMT in Conishead Priory in the restoration of the Building because of my skills and studied for more than 30 years the Classical Buddhist teachings and the different traditions within. I made Buddhist sculpture from which I supported some projects,  some of my work went to the far regions of the world and have reached the Tröde kangsar Temple in Lhasa and Tashi Lhunpo.

I took ordination in the monastic tradition of the Gelugpa school of practice (Yellow Hats) with Kyabje Song Rinpoche in 1981 on Lhabab Duchen.  

Over the years I received instructions Lama Yeshe the founder of the 
(Foundation of the international Mandala of the Preservation of the Mahayana Tradition),
the assistant tutor to the Dalai Lama, Sensap Kyabje Serkong Rinpoche, and The Abbot of Ganden Shartse monastery, Kyabje Song Rinpoche and the highly respected Lama Ganchen Rinpoche and also many learned geshes  and attended teachings from HH the Dalai Lama. 

After 1995, living away from Conishead Priory, I re- trained to work in psychiatry and psychiatric care whilst remaining ordained and travelling.

At present under the patronage of Lama Gangchen Rinpoche, I give lectures, initiations and workshops as a westerner to westerners. I have taught in Britain, the USA and Indonesia and have given assistance to students from Lancaster University whilst working on their thesis.
And am sinds 2006 the primary teacher at Dharma centre Padma Öselling in Middelburg, the Netherlands     www.padmaoselling.com

profile_positions.description: Fullfill all duties around teaching programma, empowerments, translation and working with everyone involved in the centre.   Teaching primarily in Native Dutch and English
